briefdescription.para: Enum indicating wich type of view the user wants.
List of the names for the different type of view available.
The document connected to the view, specified in the constructor.
mainDock is the main DockWidget to which all other dockWidget will be dock.

detaileddescription.para: Inititalized in the constructor.

briefdescription.para: List of the presented clusters.
List of the removed clusters.
Represents a list of list of removed clusters use to enable undo action.
Represents a list of list of removed clusters use to enable redo action.
Dimension shown on the abscissa axis.
Dimension shown on the ordinate axis.
An internal pointer to the last activated widget.
True if the view contains a Waveform view, false otherwise.
True if the view contains a Waveform view and this one is in time frame mode, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: The default is false.

briefdescription.para: True if the view contains a cluster view, false otherwise.
True if the view contains an ErrorMatrix view, false otherwise.
True if the view contains a Trace view, false otherwise.
Amount of time used in a WaveformView when looking for the spikes when the presentation mode is time frame.

detaileddescription.para: This amount is in second.

briefdescription.para: Starting time in a WaveformView when looking for the spikes when the presentation mode is time frame.

detaileddescription.para: This amount is in second.

briefdescription.para: The number of spikes to display in the WaveformView, if any, when that view is in sample mode.
Boolean indicating, for the WaveformView if any, if the waveforms for the presented clusters have to overlay.
Boolean indicating, for the WaveformView if any, if all the waveforms, corresponding to the mode of presentation, are shown or if only the mean and the standard deviation.
Size of the bins to use to compute the correlograms.
Width of the time frame to use to compute the correlograms.
True if the view contains a Correlation View, false otherwise.
Store the type of presentation used in the Correlation View if any.

detaileddescription.para: It can be raw data, data scale by the maximum valeu or data scale by the shoulder value.

briefdescription.para: List of the ViewWidgets contained in this view.
Boolean indicating if a shoulder line has to be drawn on the correlograms of the Correlation View if any.
Reference on the main window.
Counter for each type of view (ClusterView, WaveformView, CorrelationView and ErrorMatrixView) in the view.
List containing the offset for each channel in a TraceView.
List of the exponents used to compute the drawing gain for each channel in a TraceView.
Pointer to the TraceView if any.
True if labels are drawn next to the traces, false otherwise.

memberdef.name: addNewClusterToView

briefdescription.para: Adds a newly created cluster to those already shown.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
fromClusters
list of clusters from which the spikes of the new cluster are coming.
clusterId
cluster to add to the clusters already drawn.
emptiedClusters
list clusters numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

memberdef.name: addNewClustersToView

briefdescription.para: Adds newly created clusters to those already shown.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
fromToNewClusterIds
map where the keys are ids of the clusters which really contained spikes in the region and the values are the ids of the newly created clusters.
emptiedClusters
list clusters numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para:
This method aims to reduce the number of clusters to draw.
fromClusters

destinationClusterId
cluster id to which the spikes have been added
emptiedClusters
list clusters numbers which became empty because all their spikes were put in the new one.
active

briefdescription.para: Updates the mode, methode call from the application on the active view after the user selected a tool.

parameterdescription.para: the new mode.

briefdescription.para: Sets the currentViewWidget (not currently used).

Reverts the last user action.

detaileddescription.para:
If any clusters have been removed they will be added back
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Reverts the last user action.

detaileddescription.para:
If any clusters have been removed they will be added back The clusters in addedClusters, if present in shownClusters, will be removed.
addedClusters
list of clusters which were added
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Reverts the last user action.

detaileddescription.para:
If any clusters have been removed they will be added back The clusters in modifiedClusters,if present in shownClusters, will be updated.
updatedClusters
list of clusters which were modified
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Reverts the last user action.

detaileddescription.para:
If any clusters have been removed they will be added back The clusters in addedClusters, if present in shownClusters, will be removed and the clusters in modifiedClusters,if present in shownClusters, will be updated.
addedClusters
list of clusters which were added.
updatedClusters
list of clusters which were modified .
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Revers the last undo action.

detaileddescription.para:
If any clusters have been added back in the undo they will be removed again if they are shown.
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
deletedClusters
list of clusters which were deleted.

briefdescription.para: Reverts the last undo action.

detaileddescription.para:
If any clusters have been added back in the undo they will be removed again if they are shown. The clusters in addedClusters will be added back.
addedClusters
list of clusters which were added
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
deletedClusters
list of clusters which were deleted.

memberdef.argsstring: (QValueList< int > &updatedClusters, bool isModifiedByDeletion, bool active, QValueList< int > &deletedClusters)
memberdef.name: redoModifiedClusters

briefdescription.para: Reverts the last undo action.

detaileddescription.para:
If any clusters have been added back in the undo they will be removed again if they are shown. The boolean isModifiedByDeletion is used to reduce the number of cluster to redraw whenever possible. The clusters in modifiedClusters, if present in shownClusters, will be updated.
updatedClusters
list of clusters which were modified.
isModifiedByDeletion
true if the clusters of updatedClusters have been modified by the deletion of spikes (moved to cluster 0 or 1, cluster of artefact and cluster of noise respectively).
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
deletedClusters
list of clusters which were deleted.

memberdef.argsstring: (QValueList< int > &addedClusters, QValueList< int > &modifiedClusters, bool isModifiedByDeletion, bool active, QValueList< int > &deletedClusters)
memberdef.name: redo

briefdescription.para: Reverts the last undo action.

detaileddescription.para:
If any clusters have been added back in the undo they will be removed again if they are shown. The boolean isModifiedByDeletion is used to reduce the number of cluster to redraw whenever possible. The clusters in addedClusters will be added back and the clusters in modifiedClusters,if present in shownClusters, will be updated.
addedClusters
list of clusters which were added.
modifiedClusters
list of clusters which were modified.
isModifiedByDeletion
true if the clusters of updatedClusters have been modified by the deletion of spikes (moved to cluster 0 or 1, cluster of artefact and cluster of noise respectively).
active
true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.
deletedClusters
list of clusters which were deleted.

true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

true if the view is the active one, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Reverts the last undo action on a renumbering.

the time amount, in second, to use to show the waveforms.

briefdescription.para: Sets the presentation mode of the waveform view to sample mode, meaning that, for each shown cluster, only one out of the number of spikes to be displayed will be shown.
Set the presentation mode of the waveform view to time frame mode, meaning that, for each shown cluster, only the spikes within the current time frame will be shown.
Sets the way of presenting the information concerning the waveforms selected to only show the waveforms of the mean and the standard deviation.
Sets the way of presenting the information concerning the waveforms selected to show all the waveforms corresponding to the mode of presentation.
Sets the waveforms of each cluster to overlap.
Sets the waveforms of each cluster to be presented side by side.
Triggers the increase of the amplitude of the waveforms in the Waveform view.
Triggers the decrease of the amplitude of the waveforms in the Waveform view.
Returns a boolean indicating if the view contains a WaveformView.

simplesect.para: true if the view contains a WaveformView, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the view contains a WavefromView in time frame mode, false otherwise.

Returns the start time of the time frame used by the WaveformView.

briefdescription.para: overwritten QWidget::closeEvent() to catch closing views.

detaileddescription.para: Does nothing, as the closeEvents for KlustersView's are processed by KlustersApp::eventFilter(), so this overwitten closeEvent is necessary and has to be empty. Don't overwrite this method !

briefdescription.para: The KlustersView class provides the view widgets for the document instance (KlustersDoc instance) and is displayed as a MDI child window in the main view area of the KlustersApp class instance.

detaileddescription.para:
The document instance keeps a list of all views that represent the document contents as there can be more than one view. Views get created in KlustersApp::createDisplay() and automatically added to the list of views. The KlustersView class inherits QWidget as a KDockArea to give it the ability to contains dockWidgets.
Lynn Hazan
